title: "module 'deeplabcut' has no attribute 'create new project' "
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**

Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using.
Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut1.x or 2.x.
Windows 10, with an Anaconda Env, DeepLabCut (newest, downloaded yesterday (5.6.2019))
**If applicable, please also complete the following information:**
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari] Chrome
 - Version [e.g. 22]
 
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is!

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new Python project
2. run the code: 
import deeplabcut
task='xxx'
experimenter='xxxx'
video=['C:/xxx']
3. Then run the code:
path_config_file=deeplabcut.create_new_project(task,experimenter,video, working_directory='C:/Users/lenovo/deeplabcut',copy_videos=True) #change the directory as needed
4. See error
AttributeError: module 'deeplabcut' has no attribute 'create_new_project'
**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
A new project (path_config_file) be created.
**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50376505/57318743-09671a00-70c9-11e9-99cb-cd74070c5640.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50376505/57318802-27cd1580-70c9-11e9-87b5-4a7a3d974b50.png)

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
